solution.text:
Water left in the bottle after Chirag finishes drinking = Original amount - Amount he consumed
= _{j}_ - \( (\frac 35 \times _{j}_)\) litres = \(\frac {(5 \times _{j}_)-(3 \times _{j}_)}5 \) litres (Making denominators of both terms equal.
= \(_{{Fraction(2*j,5)}}_\) litres
Thus, total amount for Raghav to drink = \(_{{Fraction(2*j,5)}}_\) litres.
Portion that he drank on his way home = \( \frac 34 \)
Therefore, amount of water Raghav consumed on his way home = \( \frac 34 \times _{{Fraction(2*j,5)}}_\) litres = \(_{{Fraction(6*j, 20)}}_\) litres

content.text: Of the amount that Vishal consumed in total, he drank \( \frac 34 \) of his portion on the way back home. How much water did he drink on the way home?
